sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The book chronicles TAIRA no Masakado's downward spiral from intra-family strife to full-fledged rebellion against the state, also depicting his final moments and death and even beyond, recording as it does the so-called "message from the underworld" he is said to have sent after his death from hell.

sen.e: With respect to the time of formation, as it is written at the end of the book as "written in June 940", the view that it was written immediately after Masakado's death was dominant since the Meiji Era, but, after it became Showa, it was pointed that this indication of year is a fiction attached to the information from year the underworld.

Regarding the time of its creation, since it is written at the end of the book as "written in June 940," the view that it was written immediately after Masakado's death has predominated since the Meiji period, but since the dawn of the Showa period it has been pointed that this indication of year is a piece of fiction attached to the information from the year of the underworld.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: As for when it was written, at the very end of the manuscripts there is a note that it was "written in the sixth month of 940," so the theory that it was written immediately after Masakado's death predominated beginning in the Meiji period, but since entering the Showa period, the viewpoint has emerged that argues this date was actually a fabrication that is supposed to be attached to Masakado's message from the underworld.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
